Z11BcKtrfKn0s-iXSEVnuw.text: Rough service and mediocre food. With all of the brunch options around town, the best thing going for Elly's is it's location.

ng0i7Ktnq98I_aQwGty-ZQ.text: Grace was so friendly and knew so much about the menu. She made ordering an ease, and i'm glad it was a good first experience. The plates have big portions and there is a wide variety to choose from. You seriously can't go wrong with anything you order.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French Toast with caramelized apples

d-qCMb0rGWsmf0gfgKezOA.text: Located in a high end shopping center with plenty of parking and security roaming the premises (kind of annoying actually) makes a great breakfast spot in Phoenix. I was invited to breakfast early this Saturday morning. Party of six immediately sat, think it helped that we came at 7 A.M.   Ordered the meat lovers skillet with over medium eggs, came with a side of pancakes. The portions here are pretty large- served on an actual skillet. Personally, too much hash browns are served on the skillet making it kind of hard to find the meat. I'm sure they can do with only placing half the amount of hash browns on the skillet to have less waste. The pancakes themselves are pretty basic, no frills. Mine actually happened to be just a tad under done. Bonus point for providing room temperature butter so you can actually spread on to pancakes.   Coffee is pretty good, I didn't see any on our table nor did I ask, but no raw sugar packets. Which is my sugar of choice. Kiddo ordered the Mickey Mouse pancake served with whipped cream, strawberries, and canned pineapple. Not sure if whipped cream was from a can or fresh, hopefully fresh whipped. Unsure why canned pineapple was on pancake- maybe kids like it better or something? My kiddo didn't care for it as he loves fresh pineapple.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meat lovers skillet with a side of pancakes

5rfeCokEkxqBtC59VHYJuA.text: Man this place was packed when we came! I wonder if they're normally like that but it was extremely busy for a Sunday for brunch. The wait was probably around 20-25 minutes for my husband and I.   I ordered the banana nutella crepes and a bagel on the side. The crepes were delicious and are a pretty big portion. I also ordered one of their lattes, and their coffee is really strong!   They have a pretty good size menu so there's definitely a lot of options. I'm not sure if they do reservations or not but that would be a really good idea since they get so busy. I wish they had one on our side of town. I would definitely come back next time I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana nutella crepes

IIbBR-cgoE3BULPZGjsNRg.text: Friendly service. The staff is very attentive. Try the Spartan omelet, and you won't be disappointed. Parking is easy, location is in nice area.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oFjRpckkU5vQLLh1y-g4lQ.text: The P and I enjoy brunch, especially on a holiday weekend when we usually have a little more time and will venture out of North Phoenix to CenPho and explore a new, (and hopefully) favorite place.  Our first choice was closed so Yelp led us here, Elly's.  Located at the corner of Camelback and Central, this area has really turned the corner on hipness. Lou Malnaties is here, a spruced up AJ's, and other boutique stores.  Started off with a cocktail, duh! I've never been into Bloody Marys but decided to change it up today and really was glad I did.  Had the Diablo, extra spicy, two large olives and Ghost Pepper vodka.  The P kept telling me to slow down until breakfast was served, it was a challenge.  Note to Elly, I understand the need to prep the celery and olives to expedite the drinks but my celery was completely wilted and brown, inedible and took away from the experience-but the drink was excellent. P had mimosas and was content as always.  I had the migas frittata; spicy chorizo, avocado, jalapeno, cilantro, etc.  Sounded great on paper, on the plate, just kind of average-a little too commercial, not enough soul for me.  Spicy chorizo and jalapeno screams hot and this little doll was a lukewarm poser.  Completely edible and enjoyable but certainly will never be reordered.    Elly's menu is incredibly large and I may go back to indulge in some carbs like crepes, pancakes, or waffles. I'd definitely recommend Elly's. She has a great vibe, interesting decor and solid food & cocktails.  The service was excellent and inviting.  3.5 stars.

BDUMqR8mfYBHNHAonpiffg.text: Lot's of friends had suggested this spot for breakfast so I finally went. I ordered a omelette and hash browns. It's okay... With so many other places to go have a nice breakfast this wouldn't be my first choice. The food was just okay. Service was quick, and nice.

tMYWp5yiK6MNZXTKaCKLPA.text: Wow, this place is so busy and so loud. It has an open room concept with concrete floors so I often felt like I was yelling at the people across from me. Our particular server was pushy, rude, and often times absent. We had to get up and request several things from other staff or request her presence. However, all of the other staff was very helpful and responsive. The juice and smoothie bar was a great addition. I order the sweet potato bowl that had rice and curry. The curry was good but the rice was undercooked. The gluten free pancakes were light and fluffy! Delicious. The Nutella latte was good but very sweet. The experience overall was just Ok and I'd say that it doesn't evoke a desire to ever return.

bTtNg63PbdICAItdyNGLEQ.text: Loved Loved Loved Elly's! From the customer service to the expansive coffee menu to the cute outside patio, brunch was phenomenal. I tried the omelete with the Cherrywood bacon - Yum!! Tawni, our server was fantastic. She recommended that I try the iced cappuccino with coconut milk and Hazelnut syrup. I honestly do not think I could ever look back. It was a beauty - taste wise and visually. Portion sizes were pretty generous and prices lined up as well. This is an awesome place in a great location. Cannot wait to be back!

h2gv4PJI_8aJirVad2zV9A.text: DELICIOUS!!! Went on a Saturday morning for brunch. I tried the Chile Verde chilaquiles! I wish the chips would of been more toasted and more queso fresco.   But besides that it was AMAZING! And totally recommend. Oh, and they have $3 mimosas! They won my heart with that. lol

joD5CE3Ct4bSK1kEVW1kSQ.text: I was preoccupied when I was here, but I think I had some good coffee and a good omelet. I was with a big group and they handled it very well.

D6CqZg722FR_lOagJQlR4Q.text: I have had two great experiences at Elly's - Both times I got the waffle - once the banana nutella and the second time I asked if I could get it with the mascarpone and berries, this is not on the menu and traditionally offered on the pancakes or french toast. They accommodated the request and boy was it delicious, give this a try if you like waffles!  The waffle here has consistently been crispy and light and airy, not dense like a lot of other places.   My husband got the avocado wrap which was super bland and didn't seem to have any seasoning. I do not recommend this. The hash browns on the side that it came with were good with some salt and pepper and the latte was also decent.

3ivbB2UnyjZp7r9ynKYXFA.text: It's a very great place for breakfast and brunch. Every time I was here I was amazed by the food quality and the service.

PObDUBAgvfzm0eW2dmA0hA.text: Easy place to get breakfast early in uptown Phoenix. Great selection of food for every taste and the coffee is worth taking an extra to go. Grace is a cheerful and attentive server. Food is tasty and portions are very fair for the price. It is rumored to be crowded on weekends but on weekday mornings early you have the full attention of staff and cooks. Also, good place to get a 2-egg omelette as opposed to the ubiquitous 3-egg omelette found elsewhere.

_kDJa8mUiw9CwpUfaciydA.text: This is one of those places that the food's really good but the staff unpleasant starting you walked in the door the guy that said she never speaks to you never Smiles you follow him to the table and sit you down two servers I had have the same attitude new this is what they're going for I don't know don't get me wrong you're not rude it just seemed very unhappy NOW Foods great I was get one there Skillets I guess at least they come in at 9 skillet Ikea veggie won the best but I add feta cheese to it there gluten free pancakes are amazing I try to come here any chance I get definitely worth bad attitude

eiF3nOOzD1RmQxyHZKO8kA.text: Baby is due next week, so my husband and I had the day off to spend some time hanging out and prepping the house. Tried this place for a breakfast date and were super impressed! Our waitress, Julie, was super personable and kind. I got an omelet with French toast, both of which were awesome. I topped the omelet with their delicious homemade salsa, which put it over the top. Husband got the southwest frittata and declared it one of the best things he's eaten. Seriously, great service and great food - we will be back!

IUjy_n96DIcGTuQg0-xwpw.text: this place is amazing . ordered the chicken & waffles with a glass of milk . the waitress was so polite . beautiful place to eat outside . i can only give 5 starts , but if i could id give them 10 !

bONczhq7kPPCCeeSoxOCwQ.text: This place was pretty good overall. I ordered the meat lovers skillet with a side of berry mascarpone pancakes. The meat lovers skillet came with ham which I was not a fan of but the bacon and the sausage along with the wisconsin cheese were decent. The pancakes were delicious; they weren't the best pancakes in the valley but they were still fluffy and tasty especially with the mascarpone. The coffee was strong the way I like it. The place itself is cute, especially the outside patio overlooking central and camelaback. The servers were wonderful. I will definitely be back.

KpvI2uBtnVtA9P9_9m32Lg.text: Stopped in for breakfast today ordered Gravalax which turned out to be bagel cream cheese and lox.It was done nicely came with hash browns...only 9.00 which is a great price..very deserving of the 5 stars

PvkJgeGWz-BiIqmesFYVmw.text: This is by far one of the best breakfast/brunch places I have had in some time. The place is very clean and very friendly. The food is amazing!!!! The waffles and pancakes are so good they just melt in your mouth. We will definitely be coming back to try out more plates. Top service and food. Great job!

HixhH9a5aVfyKjepw0puWw.text: Been coming here since it open and have not stop. The chilaquiles are my favorite and then the egg Benedict's a close second and the avocado wrap as well. The waffles are amazing and the americanos are great as well. Get there early or expect long waits.

ru1tO5wikeZBhu-ogJtsnw.text: Elly's is great.  Food and service are very good.  They have a small outdoor eating area too.

cTnirHcmAsCrGyt8lEQgSQ.text: We've been to Elly's twice. First, we brought our kids (9 & 3) on a weekend morning and the second time, I came by myself on a weekday morning.  Major plusses- - the place is huge so the likelihood that you'll have to wait a half an hour or more to get a table is really small.  - location is terrific. - each of the times we were here the staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming.  Elly's doesn't read hipster to me at all. It reads as a classic breakfast joint, kid friendly, straightforward.  Unlike a lot of our breakfast places around town, which I also love by the way, Elly's is really classic (not in the French way) in terms of menu. You won't find any wild and crazy concoctions here.  Yes, the menu is extensive, but it is comprised of just a handful of essential ingredients changed up for different menu items.  Skillets and scrambles Benedicts Pancakes, crepes, and waffles A couple different kinds of bread And a variety of veggies, meats, and cheeses to satisfy any palette  We really liked the food. My kids loved their crepes and pancakes. My over medium eggs were cooked perfectly, which is typically not the case elsewhere.   If you keep your expectations simple, Elly's is easy to enjoy and perfect for a close-by family breakfast.

PanCAt20QDdJ1HfZKHAA3A.text: You know how I love brunch, and this place does it right. The husband and I ate at Elly's shortly after they opened. We were impressed with their service and their food. Our waiter had great suggestions on what to order. On his recommendation, I got the ole skillet and oh em gee it was tasty! The chorizo was spicy, the eggs were cooked perfectly, the portion was huge.... and, on top of all that, it came with a freakin pancake! For real. The prices are average for brunch (we spent around 30$ for the two of us after everything).  I'll definitely be back.

GZOv6L7wmGO7f0XB6VxpVw.text: Walked in at 8:45 am on a Sunday knowing we may before the church rush. We were. Elly's was much bigger than we expected. We were greeted at least three times by the host and several others engaged about our morning. Very nice. Noticed a German pancake on the menu, but the prep time is 45 minutes. Hmmmm. We ordered that to go as we ordered other food for the table. BTW orange juice was fresh squeezed and SWEET! Get what you are craving. It's all prepared well. Will be back as a staple when we visit our college student. Ten minutes from GCU. German pancake was crispier than expected based on a traditional Pancake House, but very good. Don't know that I would wait 45 minutes to be served. Perhaps call ahead?

kGJCMyZuqo6QjDF2k0XGaA.text: Great place to eat. We enjoy breakfast there. Their coffee is tasty and rich. Portion sizes are generous. The crepes are delicious!  Service is also great. All the time! Our barista Sherri is especially friendly.

gar9OlgFjBmxFWV9C5QEHA.text: This is an adorable small chain that is just nice enough to be bougie while still retaining a bit of Waffle House diner charm.  The pancakes are amazing, they have real maple syrup instead of Breakfast Syrup and the fluffy pancakes absorb it all without falling apart.  The mushrooms in my steak and shrooms skillet were cooked PERFECTLY.  I will seek this place out the next time I'm in the area.

eLGdylMVHtJskjTvqLu3jg.text: Perfect spot to have breakfast or brunch with a friend. The bakery items are delicious and the speciality coffees will start your morning right. Fresh made preserves are a treat. The service is always inviting and kind. Great light inside and in the cooler months, the patio is the perfect spot for people watching in the courtyard.

oMIfvKEfRX86uydQpdYKAA.text: I love this place for numerous reasons... the place is empty when ever we go probably because I go later in the day after the rush...the menu has sooo many options but I always try to call an hour before and order the Dutch pancake it's HUGE!! You will definitely want to share it my favorite is the apple... the coffee is delicious it has that donut shop/diner taste which I love ... I always ask for my hash browns extra crispy and they give them to me crispppppy yum! All in all great choices great menu and even more amazing staff!!!

7mzkcKo2u9FcMzMVinxzLA.text: For our first time:  We came in on Sunday around 1:00 pm and were expecting a wait. We were pleasantly surprised to see how big it was on the inside and we didn't have to wait to get a booth.   The menu is great. It has great a nice variety of skillets, omelets, and breakfast sandwiches.   I ordered the homemade corn-beef hash and eggs with a side of pancakes. For this particular dish they pair it with a poached egg. I always tend to go with the recommendations of the kitchen and gave it a shot. When my dish came out I cut into the poached egg to see the golden liquid flow out on the white light pillow. The pancakes came out, they were two stacks, and extremely fluffy!! Everything was exactly what I wanted. Yumm factor: very high.   My dining companion had the meat skillet. It was big, cheesy, crispy hasbrown, and full of meat. Everything you would want in a skillet. He decided to get the pancakes as well which were just as fluffy.   As far as the logistics goes:   The restaurant was clean. The staff was very friendly. The owner came by and made us laugh. The prices were very reasonable for the amount of food we ate. The staff worked together to make sure our drinks were filled and our plates were cleared. The services was very satisfactory.   The only one draw back was the kitchen needs to fine tune exactly what to fire. Our food which was extremely delicious, came out to our table at different times.   Will we go back?: HECK YES! This restaurant is  close (check), has great staff (check), has great food (check), and great prices (check).  VERDICT: Go and check it out for sure!  BTW: The only reason it is a 4 and not 5 star is the lack of liquor license. I would have loved a Bloody Mary with my breakfast.

1-o8bIEN5doN8aqMVg0sbA.text: First time here....  I must say all the pictures on yelp do not do it justice, this place has great 90's music playing and a fun atmosphere. Our waitress Debbie was Amazing!!!  She has such a great positive attitude and provided great service, she was on point.  We came here to celebrate our cousins 1st wedding Anniversary and I was worried that this place was going to be a bust.  BUT I was greatly Impressed, the food was delicious and on point on how we ordered it.  When we come back into town again, we will visit again.

YPItBJBOBF9EmIp4K83THw.text: Love this place -- It's now my fave breakfast restaurant.The Buttermilk pancakes were amazing -- perfect in every way and bite. The side of sausage was delish. Our server was spot on -- Love everything about this place. I look forward to trying other entrees on the menu. Cheers***

H8enFoP4PkaZABXg4aCFhg.text: Our favorite Sunday brunch place! Everything on the menu is delicious. Coffee is always fresh and their fresh squeezed juices and smoothies are to die for. They have great fancy drinks too like the mimosa made your way. Highly recommend. Only downfall is that it is small and there is usually a wait time. So be ready to have a relaxing brunch not rushed.

tHQqu6-mwCrzUHm7mxcM3Q.text: This beautifully hot summer Sunday my boyfriend and I went to Elly's looking for a new brunch place we hadn't been to before. After reading some yelp reviews we decided to go. When we got to Elly's it was packed and had some couples in front of us, the hostess said there would be a 20 minute wait for a table, but we got in less than 5 minutes from walking in. When we sat down we looked over the menu and were greeted by our server who brought water and a smile.   My boyfriend ordered a coffee and I ordered a hot nutella latte. There was a bit of a mix up between the runners and our server who placed a cold nutella latte in front of me but our server corrected it and apologized saying it was for the next table down. We then ordered our meal I got the Sticky Bun and my boyfriend ordered the Chilequiles, which was by far the star of the meal. The buns were good but by the end they were getting a bit too sweet even for my sweet tooth.   I did see that between the staff there were some mix up in food orders and that there were runners and servers trying to find where dishes were suppose to go. But that all comes with new staff and a new restaurant system.   All in all it was a great place for brunch. There were lots of families and couples so it's a wonderful place for all ages. The food was excellent and fresh, the staff smiling and apologetic if anything went wrong. It's also within the hub of north central Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilequiles
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sticky buns
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nutella latte hot

RJJ-A1-iaH-0HwcVhQzHew.text: This place is fantastic. The staff is by far the best part of the experience. Kenneth was very attentive and funny. The food was great as well. It came out hot and in a timely fashion. I definitely have a new place to go every time I come to Phoenix.

4NGG9c5YfX6P0ce0fCcnEg.text: What a wonderful find! Our son recommended this restaurant, as we were trying to find something close to his work. A spacious, open and comfortable restaurant, we knew we were in for a treat.   We received wonderful service, and lots of choices. I started with their chai latte, which was a delight. The menu was huge, so we took our time. I opted for their original Benedict. It features "fall off the bone ham" and that's what you get.  So savory and delicious.   My husband ordered an avocado-kiwi smoothie, which he loved.  He also got the waffle, which was great. Our son had an omelette which was very filling.    Great first experience!

utWwPR2SNM9R4edNi9AfEA.text: Went here for brunch today with my daughter, first time here for me, more than once been here for her.   It's stuck in the back of the shopping center with AJ's as its anchor; therefore, one better know it's there cause there's no street signage, that's for sure.  I had the Hawaiian omelet with an extra side of sausage links, and she had the avocado wrap.   Mine came with hash browns and a choice of pancakes, and hers came with hash browns with a choice of fresh fruit.  She also ordered cold press coffee with cream.   She thought the cream would be on the side.   It wasn't; it was added, and she declared it too sweet.   I liked it so I drank it.  The omelet was good.    The addition of the pineapple is interesting, but I knew it would be added so that's all right.   It was light and fluffy with the addition of the other ingredients.   The hash browns and pancakes were good, nothing spectacular that made them stand out but good.  She said her wrap was good as well, and since she finished it, it must have been.  Our server was professional and friendly.   I'd probably return cause of the variation of the menu.   It seems to be a good breakfast location as far as the choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. side of two pancakes
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hawaiian omelet and hash browns with side of link sausages
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado wrap with hash browns

7Vl0TI1DFt6Cl16ywpvgCQ.text: A good place for a cup of coffee.  This place is just ok. Big portions at a decent price. If you are looking for high quality ingredients or any flair in cooking you should go elsewhere.  What was good:  1. The coffee. A very decent Americano. 2. The service was excellent. 3. The place is nice and clean, if a little barn like. 4. They have a gluten free menu.  Not so good:  The food. The first tell is the very large menu. Nobody can do  that many dishes well. I had an omelette. It turned out to be more of  a tasteless egg hash. The toast was not toasted. The kitchen that can't turn out a piece of toast... Need I say more...  Any home cook could do better.

pPRj05pSVBHe1R9Sog7EQQ.text: Didn't even know this was in the Uptown Plaza. Down the alley way across from Lou Malnati's .  Place is quite large and had a nice little patio.  Still doing the low carb crap so was kind of lame in my ordering... but everything was delicious.  Got the Gravalox Bowl and scrambled eggs and sausage.  Service was outstanding.  Very attentive and super nice. I'll be back when I drop some pounds.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs/sausage
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gravalox Bowl
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs

xMCuuV4hq1eEc3yU01EL-g.text: Cute brunch spot, but the savory food lacked a lot of flavor and seasoning in my opinion.  The restaurant looks really small from the outside but they have plenty of seats inside; good for groups of any size. We decided to dine outside because the weather was nice. Thankfully we beat the brunch crowd because we were seated immediately.  The service was great and they constantly checked up on us. They made sure our waters were filled and everything was okay. They have a huge menu with tons of sweet and savory brunch items. I ordered the steak & wild mushroom skillet and it included two pancakes and two eggs cooked to my preference. Half of my skillet was hash browns and it didn't come with as much steak as I wanted, but for $13 I shouldn't set my expectations that high. My only complaint is that the meal lacked a lot of flavor and I had to eat it with extra salt, pepper, and ketchup. I also took some samples of my in-law's sandwiches and I wasn't impressed by those either. They enjoyed their sandwiches but I'm picky with food. The pancakes were fluffy and good though.  I wouldn't mind trying this place again because the service was great. I'd probably try a sweet brunch item instead of a savory one though.  If you are looking for an affordable brunch spot with big portions, this place might be for you! But don't say I didn't warn you about the lack of flavor..

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Reuben Sandwich + fries
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak &amp; Wild Mushroom Skillet, includes 2 pancakes and 2 eggs
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside dining area

RZVdgQYopskFgY4qKNahUA.text: Such a hidden gem! The food was great! Service was great. I don't know what those people were talking about when they said the food had no flavor. I loved everything. We got the French toast with berries, apple cinnamon pancakes and chilequillas. I would get the French toast and maybe try something else. I didn't mind the others but open to try something that is as good as the French toast. Prices were very reasonable.

UNnmslafdqsfiq9A7CvWjA.text: Stopped in for breakfast twice on our recent trip to Phoenix and both times we were pleased with the food and service. With a wide ranging menu and good prices Elly's is a worthwhile stop, especially for breakfast.   The food is served hot and fast. For the adults the omelette, frittatas, and hash are recommended AND they come with pancakes instead of toast. For the kids the French toast is really tasty and honestly enough to feed an adult!  Outdoor seating here was always in the shade and there's enough room outside the kids to run around so if you're looking for a family spot I recommend Elly's.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hs90cjLm6Zp4Jdv1saFM5g.text: First time trying Elly's. We both ordered the morning star omelet. I got banana nutella pancakes with mine, my husband got toast. He asked for 2 orders of toast. When the food arrived he received 2 slices of toast and I asked for his 2nd order and the waitress said that is 2 orders. I knew she was lying, what will I do? Argue about toast. I looked at other yelp pictures, every one received 2 slices with their order. So 2 +2=4?? Why lie? Just say, oh let me go get the other toast.  Anyway. As for the food- Everything tasted really well made and delicious.  Everything was well priced for what you get. If you get pancakes upgrade to banana nutella- so worth the $$ Comfortable dining area.

QNTGsOLQ4Vr87_GieSiYKg.text: I've been wanting to try Elly's since moving to this area, and we finally had a chance to go a few weeks ago! One of my favorite aspects was the atmosphere and the way it looks inside. It kind of reminded me of some of the popular breakfast places in Ocean Beach, which automatically put me in a good mood :) We sat out on the patio, which was decorated in a very cute way as well. It seems like a very family- and pet-friendly place, it was great! The service was also excellent; our waiter was super nice and competent, considering it was pretty busy while we were there, too.   For breakfast I had the Brioche French Toast (plain, no fruit) and it was the best French toast I've had in a while. Simple, but delicious.

dd7yoiSWRzR5ibqtOJpFvQ.text: Yummy food and great service ! I would definitely come back if I'm in the area! The menu has good variety and the drinks are awesome

GoK7v0uH_ts01zhr9vsekQ.text: I have to say breakfast is my 1st favorite meal. So let us begin this journey of food description.   Coffee- bomb so flavorful dark and needs no cream, no sugar and after the 4th cup I was convinced.   Then they customized my omelette to a meal lovers.  And being a lover of meat it has my stamp of approval. The hash browns yummy I could describe it with crunch and seasoned so good. But I choose yummy. The pancakes they are not the pancake house but they knocked it out of  the park.   Service- Gillian was so fun cool and helpful. Glasses always full. (Ex. 4 cups of coffee)   Price- one phrase "Hell yes". For the amount of food, the flavor of food, and how fast the food came. Can't beat it.   Go if you get a chance I'll be back many more times

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious

EPQgOFiG-nE8_5FnCynoNw.text: A friend of mine suggested Elly's for brunch this morning, and I was interested in giving it a try. At 11:00 am we had about a 20 minute wait, which isn't too bad considering there are lots of cute little boutiques that you can pop in and look around that are within short walking distance. I ordered the Morning Sunrise omelette, which was actually quite good! The egg was fluffy, and it had bacon, avocado, onion and cheese inside. The hash-browns were bland, but a pinch of salt and some Cholula hot sauce helped that. I thought the toast was hard as a brick, but my friend did state she likes hard toast so I guess that would be up to preference. The restaurant itself is extremely noisy - I don't know what it is about the reverberation in there, but it's pretty droning when filled with people and the clashing of dishes is deafening. As I told my friend, it's not a place I would bring my grandparents.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Morning Sunrise omelette

ghTI_fTCfWGSB5iAZBBBHQ.text: Great spot!   Uptown probably has the best food and the breakfast is never a disappointment.  This place is more kid friendly than most and just perfect for families.   The service is great and are very fast.   They give big portions too.  Love coming here!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hash browns, bacon and poached eggs!  Love it!!!

acb8Z8RkFJlmVjgW13hfpA.text: Yay! I am a fan of this place.  The biscuits and gravy, while not the best in town, are delicious.  The ham off the bone they specialize in is great on the eggs benedict.  I have been here only for breakfast but I would bet they do lunch just as well.

u4CxBZqmp8CKn3T9UD6tZA.text: My second time at Elly's and as delicious as the first! Got seated right away (no wait) and service was good and not long wait on the food coming out. They have the best hash browns I've ever had! I got the classic waffle with a side egg and side hash browns. Everything was good - would definitely come back!

NmMmWcbvoUY2LjKjwzQIsg.text: Tried this place out on a very busy Sunday morning and it was worth the wait!   We waited about 20 mins for a table but as soon as we sat down, the service was super speedy! The amount of time we waited for a table took much longer than actually waiting for our food! I was surprised and impressed since it was pretty busy.   So the service was great, but the food was just as good! I ordered the Southwest frittata with a side of pancakes. The portion was big enough for at least two people to share! It was so good and tasty!!   The only downside is that there isn't a lot of waiting room inside. So it sucks when they're on a wait on a really hot (or "cold") day!

kSYqNN4FTi-fSp9Fs28cvg.text: My husband and I love coming here for brunch. Super reasonably priced! I hate when places charge an arm and a leg for something like eggs or French Toast. I love their French Toast, it's one of the best I've had and I get French Toast almost every time we go to a brunch place.  I had an iced chai latte and loved it! We've had the same server the last couple of times we've been there and she wasn't too great, hardly talked to us. But the food was great and came out very quickly so can't complain!  Love it!! Definitely a place that we will continue going to. It's also in a great location, in the Up Town Plaza on Central and Camelback, so the atmosphere is great.

KWAbUaaJxOX38pHJO6R3LQ.text: Just really good, fresh food prepared well. The Migas Frittata was tasty with subtle heat and accompanied by a nice salsa Fresca. All in all it was fresh and casual.

qhvAquSWZhLCWsWCPpwegQ.text: Came here on a Sunday. Super packed but the wait wasn't that long. Our server was great the food came out fast and  delicious. So far Arizona  is better than DC. Everybody so nice here!

Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn beef Hash

RrWZ8ucO5B1m9e5VE0m2qQ.text: I just moved here and I was googling places to go for breakfast and Elly's popped up. This place has a very cute ambiance. The menu is a decent size and has a good variety of options. Service was good. Food was AMAZING!!

j00G5h-uhu-qyWECTA2HCA.text: First time at the Arizona location. The restaurant is huge, modernish looking. Host was very welcoming, the restaurant was nearly empty on a Tuesday morning around 730. The food was good. I got the waffle and eggs, my boyfriend got the egg sandwich which comes with a huge portion of hash browns. He said the sandwich was really good, he also got a side of the brioche French toast. He said my waffle tasted better then the French toast, nothing to write home about. We will be back when we have more time to try the German pancake (takes 30 min to bake). Our server was very attentive, great service.  Gave this restaurant another try. We tried the Dutch baby, the country benedict and the regular Benedict. The server seemed to forgot about out Dutch baby (I know they take awhile to cook) but we ordered the Dutch baby as soon as we sat down. Then once he came back to take our order we ordered the bene's. The server cleaned up our plates and asked if we needed anything else and we said our Dutch baby. He looked like he had that "oh crap look." Not saying he forgot to put the order in because he brought us syrup at the beginning, but we did have to wait about 20-25 more minutes after finishing our food for the Dutch baby to come out. Country bene was good, my boyfriend thought the gravy could be better. He said the Dutch baby was cooked perfect tho. We came Saturday about 9 and it was very busy, no wait quite yet but almost full.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Country Bene

cP2H7QRkhbpeigQdXnd4lA.text: I recently visited Elly's for my first time and enjoyed my breakfast, coffee and excellent service. I have been back two additional times with friends for brunch and I plan on coming back for more delicious food, coffee and great service.

o7Ea-IywRDvhdvMVf3D17g.text: I don't understand all the 3 and 4 stars that stated everything was great and they would definitely be back?????   Well we have been here at least 15-20 times with 2-16 people and everything in between including lots of kids.  The food and service have been over the top every single time.  When they were extremely busy the wait time was very acceptable.  We have never had a bad menu item, never a cold entree, and never broken toast as stated in one review. ( however if mine was broken it would just save time in having to break off a piece) The hostess' that seat you have always been helpful, overly friendly, and always with a big smile.  One review stated no one smiled.....ridiculous.  Ellys has has gotten a bad rap in stars which in turn hurts their location order.  Please read into the different reviews of less than 5 stars and you'll see for yourself....Perfection will not make them give a positive or 5 star review!!!!!!!!!!!  Note:  We live at 91st Ave and Peoria Ave. and this is the by far the best breakfast restaurant we have....so we drive the 35 minutes for a great experience.  SFH (Going in the AM.)

NK7Lch1XzOpIFVZ9V6Rzwg.text: I was looking forward to trying a new restaurant in my neighborhood with an early opening, but I made two huge mistakes on my first visit.  One mistake was coming alone, and the other was walking on a summer morning. The staff seated me but apparently decided my sweaty, single self wasn't a legit customer, as with the restaurant 80% empty, they simply didn't serve me. No water, no coffee, no "be just a minute," no "any questions about the menu?" -- every staffer acted as if I were invisible. Clear intent was to get me to leave, so I did.  If you feel your look and pedi can pass the Elly's Test, be warned that the place is LOUD and feels like a hipster cafeteria. Intimate conversation? Not gonna happen. Working on your laptop or tablet? Good luck with that!   (My pedicure actually has reached the state of being kind of gross, but I'm putting my feet UNDER the table, not on it, and I'm expecting to be brought coffee, not have my toes sucked.)  The menu is basic chi-chi upscale farm-raised stuff, so if you sleep in, just go to Flower Child at the front of the same plaza.

OoJayavhbDrKQMpFHWnQEQ.text: Great place to relax and have a peaceful meal... Staff is very nice and accommodate to your requests.  This past Saturday morning I met one if the co-owners.  She was awesome...I apologize for forgetting her name.. I will continue to frequent this place.

tzd3KgiMjRmf4Y_WR39dRw.text: It was OK.  We went at 12:00Pm i had the chicken salad wrap and my friend had the sausage and eggs.  We both had bloody mary's .   It was OK.  SO LOUD.  SO NOISY.  I wouldn't go back. It was Sunday, maybe try it during the week.  They are fixing the parking lot.  Hard to find parking.

dMxOnWe9FgJJiAyxw9eo8Q.text: Visiting the area over the Christmas break and was looking for a brunch spot before heading home. The reviews did not disappoint.   They catered to every modification on our orders without any push back. When we asked for a change the response was always, "sure, no problem". I really love this attitude!   The food was tasty. The omelettes were cheesy and well prepared. Tastes fresh and there wasn't an overload of grease as some places tend to have. The pancakes were light fluffy and tasty. The one drawback was the Nutella was not Nutella, but watered down and perhaps even caramelised a bit, tasty nevertheless buy not what I wanted.   Overall top notch place. Great service, great food, great atmosphere.

Bk-wF3v5cNDk5ymabR2L4A.text: I was there yesterday with a couple of friends at lunch time. They have terrible customer service. Our waitress was rude and incompetent. She stated she could not give all of us our drinks because there was not enough cups to go around for everyone. I finished most of my meal by the time I got my Orange juice, which I had to ask for it, for a second time. My bill was $20.10, I gave the waitress $40.10 and asked for her to give me change for the 20 dollar bill and said "okay". I got the tab back and realize she only gave me back $10 and tipped her self a generous amount of $10 without my consent. At this point I went up to the counter and explain the issue to a second waitress. The waitress turns around and hands it to our waitress. The waitress then argues with me and only gives me 5 dollars back. She still managed to keep my money without my consent. It's definitely a issue that should be addressed by management and not ignored.

XxEOvP6F8bvJRLESaW7pdg.text: This was a first and I loved it so much. First, our server Jesse was beyond great. He asked if we had been there before and made recommendations. Food was delicious and so reasonably priced! we finished our food, but were not ready to leave (catching up with a close friend). Jesse offered coffee a couple times. We declined and then finally said yes. He said as he poured our coffee "It's always nice to have coffee when you're talking..." So sweet, because it's so True.   Nice people and good food.  We had chilaquiles, pancakes, and avocado wrap.  thank you Jesse!

5C7-dcyCZ4nEbKhBchYUGQ.text: I came here on New Years Eve and first thing worth noting is how fast i was seated. I requested a table for two and although very full, i was seated within 5 minutes.   The location is very open and family friendly.  Moderate noise is very accurate. The large open seating helps drown out the noise though. The menu isn't too big which is a good thing sand made it easy to order. I got the Latina omelette and a Bloody Mary while a friend got a mimosa.   Drinks were a little pricy for the size, but the dishes were very filling. The pancakes on the side were decent. The dish was filling but mediocre in general. The waitress was attentive but not overbearing. We got the check in a timely fashion and were out of there.  In conclusion, i would come back but i would definitely get something else and hold off on the special drinks.

wguxeDT49jEJDpMoo7g_dw.text: Came back here with co-workers and family 3 separate times and each time I was disappointed. Meals weren't the same, the wait was horrible only to get inside and see half the restaurant empty and our waiter seemed to not want to be there, unfortunately we got the same waiter 2 out of the 3 visits back.  Would I come back? Sure, are they my top choice for recommendations? Not so much..and I raved about them initially.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak&amp; Mushroom skillet quality went down with each additional visit
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 5

HD-21gyOFEn1q_YjszZMHA.text: I stopped in to the restaurant around 2:20 was seated quickly. The women at the front wasn't very warming . ( in fact when a women walked in at 245 she had the look of annoyance on her face.)   - closes at 3:00  My waitress came over quickly and was friendly and seemed in a great mood. She explained the food selection well .   I ordered everything hard ( well done) as i don't like undercooked, soggy or any chance to get sick.   Food came and it was fresh and hot. Omelette was well proportioned , potatoes were done correctly. Pancakes were soft ( not hard)..   AND my sausage was pink..undercooked..PORK !!!! ( That ended my happy thoughts right there. )  Overall.. If the sausage was cooked correctly, i would have given the place a 2 or 3. Its a great location, open spaced, staff ( except the lady at the front) was welcoming..but the food was basic, like your moms cooking.) It has no signature style, no twist or "elly" to the food,  the pancakes had no flavor, the syrup was thin..   Sorry.

NxDEkcV4hy5cmI3-xjH1Cw.text: I came in with my friend and we had the most amazing experience. Megan was our server and was so sweet to us, kept checking up on us, and was in general incredible. The food was so good, generous portions, we were no close to finishing! A great place, we've always had great experiences, and a big shout out to the cooks, it looked like there were only 2 of them taking care of the whole restaurant! Make sure to check it out :)

KazFx2TcSwzqFWl_3Qwa1Q.text: Phenomenal service. Food was amazing. Ordered mom a cappuccino and she said"Best fu***** cappuccino ever"...... .

-85-UDIs23t1QGTLLqMWBQ.text: I love this place! The staff is friendly. The wait is sometimes long but it is worth it because the food is so yummy.  I also love the ambiance and location. :)

BkdTzTeb6gDlJ8koLKV8PA.text: Located in Windsor square. Great food options! The smell as you walk in make you hungry! Had a good overall experience and the staff was friendly

8QUZ02XUcft1l2_usoacsQ.text: I had heard about this place as THE place to get shredded (not cubed) hash browns that are nice and crispy (my favorite!) and so I hurried on over and ordered a basic two egg over medium (perfectly cooked) with bacon (delicious!), hashbrowns and an English Muffin. It was all perfect! The hashbrowns were incredibly good, the bacon is really thick and perfectly cooked, and everything just tasted like a real breakfast. The waiter was so enthusiastic about my simple order, and the atmosphere, although in a large space, felt really nice to me. I highly recommend this place for breakfast!

aQophrt3INML4I1J_JMyEQ.text: We came for Sunday brunch so we knew it might be a wait but the 20-25 minute wait was only about 15. The food tasted great and the service was awesome. We received some free pastries just for giving the table next to us some chalula sauce! It was GREAT! I would definitely come back to try more menu options.

AJFkUSbFcuTNFZLnv7Cf5Q.text: Great breakfast and service. My family and I started a new tradition of goin to breakfast twice a month. Elly's was awesome, cute decor, kind friendly and clean. You must try the apple cinnamon pancakes, flavored perfectly and the pancakes were nice and fluffy.

NV88fb7ogz2zpK1oe7kNSg.text: Incredible brunch, all we've ordered is breakfast, but the breakfast is excellent. Large portions, reasonable prices, from omelets to pancakes to French toast, it's very tasty.

uDJGnP7CSon--STlLA2atw.text: I am glad I gave Elly's another try today. They have a very large menu with many great choices.  I had the steak and mushroom skillet and it was very good. The service was also very friendly. The first time we went there was a problem with being understaffed but they have done a great job getting back to 5 star status. The coffee is great!

rb-i3wTmPc5TMQqd1ITcfg.text: Took my father and family here for Father's Day. It was busy which resulted in our food coming out slowly, which I understand. My dad got an omelet with a side of pancakes, I ordered the chicken and waffles, rest of the family also got pancakes and some form of eggs. We put in the order and about 10 minutes later, the waiter came back and told me they were out of chicken and waffles. Mind you, it is 9:30am, no more than a few hours after opening. So I instead ordered the french toast with a side of chicken sausage. The french toast was bland and dry, the chicken sausage was amazing! Whatever the brand, probably the best I have had. Everybody said the eggs were okay, but the pancakes were super dry and had too much vanilla. Do not know if we will return

avlqxrHoyjUxjae4ejE0Nw.text: I wasn't impressed. I came here with two friends. The hostess seemed to be having a private conversation on the phone so couldn't greet me. A waitress standing behind her greeted me but she seemed a little odd. I asked to sit outside and she rudely told me that my party was too large to sit on the patio. Ok. So we sat inside. Even though no one was in the restaurant in took her an insanely long time to bring waters and coffee.   When the food arrived I immediately noticed a hair in my hashbrowns. I had the hair on the fork and I was holding it up to show her at which time the waitress rudely and loudly shouted "well, don't eat it!". Ok, why would I eat  a hair? Clearly she was just being a jerk.  Then the bill came and it appeared I was being charged for my meal but not my coffee. Ok, I thought, usually restaurants comp your meal if a hair was in it but maybe she just comped my coffee? Wrong. She didn't comp anything. When she noticed she didn't charge my coffee she took the bill back and re- did it! You've got to be kidding me! Won't be coming back..

XqKm4617WpHdUvPihLT8kw.text: I saw this recommended somewhere, so I went on a whim. I am so glad I did. I had huevos rancheros and it's an excellent treatment of an old standard. There are so many menu choices I will have to return. My server, Carlos, was attentive and lots of help.

sZZSH41aj4Xqsh8ubYcjWA.text: Was stunned / completely caught off guard when I just ordered a small coffee to go = 4.35... I have a son that will be dropped off @ Brophy 400+ times over the next 4 years - which would have been followed by a cup of coffee and a possible breakfast mtg somewhere on camelback between the 7's during this time period - it's highly unlikely that Elle's is an option going forward. AJ's is right next door = 65% less...

dhrthdqQPcfzl-Zrl7GUTw.text: I was very excited for a new brunch option near us so I am very sad to write this.  The location is great as we visit flower child once or twice a week.  They were very busy on a Sunday and the waitress was working hard but she didn't ask us how the food was.  I could tell she was a good and seasoned waitress so I assume others have had my experience and she didn't want to deal with it.  We were in a rush so we did not voice our food issues with management.  We all left sizeable portions of our meals uneaten because it was just bad.  My wife's eggs benedict was overpoweringly lemon flavored, eggs were cooked all the way through and hash browns were tasteless.  My 4 & 6 year old's eggs tasted like they had no salt or butter and were runny.  Pancakes were also overdone and crispy.  They also didn't like their hash browns.  I had chicken and waffles and the waffle was good but the chicken was so fatty I couldn't believe it.  They might have been the fattiest chicken legs I have ever eaten.    I can't remember the last time that none of my family had a good meal.  The restaurant was very busy and we waited a while so I was hopeful to get quality food.  Maybe I'll give it another try in the future and see if they've worked out their issues but for now I cannot recommend :(

hQ9nRvb3n2A0u2JCm3KGtA.text: I'm sorry, no. My friend and I tried this on our lunch hour. We love breakfast  at any time of day. Jesse was our server, nice enough guy but honestly felt like he was just filling in for the day. No typical server banter, Just Hi I'm Jesse, what can I get you?  My friend ordered the stuffed avocado and I ordered the Ole omelette. What she received was a sliced avocado with giant chunks of chicken slathered in mayonnaise. No seasoning, nothing crunchy in there, nothing. Chicken and mayo. Not appetizing at all. My omelette - not good. It looked like the aftermath of an omelette, a scramble maybe but this was no omelette. Looks aside it didn't taste good either. I did have some crispy hash browns. I ate those after a dosing of salt and pepper that was lacking. And the side of bacon we ordered, tasty. But its bacon, even at it's worst, it's still ok.  I so wanted to love this, it just disappointed on so many levels.

FODK0Tee9R6V2syOtu6o3g.text: Have you ever tried to make an omelet only to have it turn into scrambled eggs during the flip? That is exactly how this place feels, and also how my "omelet" was presented. Came to check out the new place with husband and new baby for brunch and was underwhelmed. Thankfully there was no wait, they sat us at a bigger table to accommodate for our infant carrier and the cold brew was yummy! Unfortunately, my omelet was essentially scrambled eggs arranged in a log and the hash browns were overcooked on the outside and almost raw in the middle. My breakfast came with a side of pancakes which were decent, nothing to write home about. The restaurant is huge inside, but felt awkward only being about a third full. The service was a little slow, I think the staff was still trying to figure things out. Ultimately, I would say skip the visit here and stick with a tried and True.

WU6BPlh75T2n5Gpr3zINtw.text: Ok ... tried it again.  It's still 2 stars.  The food just isn't good.  Toast served cold along with cold butter.  Sorry Elly I won't be back.

kXXAWqAXvWbMKfrlMAGasg.text: Inability to be served due to long wait time ruined my FIRST Mother's Day. On my first Mother's Day myself, my husband, my 3 month old, and one of my best friends decided to try this Chicago transplant out for brunch. I'd seen it on the news that they just opened this location and wanted to give this new location a try. Since I'm a Midwest girl, and Love Chicago, I picked this place to have brunch with my family. I'd visited Elly's in Chicago for brunch and loved it there, so I was expecting the same here---- not so.  Big disappointment. We were on their waiting list for over 40 minutes, when initially told there was a 20 minute wait. When our names weren't called after 40 minutes we went in to check and was told that they are now putting the list of names for people waiting "on hold" because their kitchen is backed up on orders, and priority is being given to those with reservations. Now I'm hungry, my infant son is cranky, and we have to find someplace else for brunch. We are  VERY disappointed in the way service was handled.

5nbWzcDXclbGsvEWIvlkGA.text: Never go back no taste at all on the food put a little salt goes a long way this restaurant is not gonna last more likely to go out business in the next couple months if they keep up with this

vkZLnV9bcSjWDS0jw_DKfw.text: Came here this morning to try a new spot, we asked to be seated outside where we waited almost 15 minutes for anyone to even come out. There were servers standing around talking to each other and we made eye contact with more than one of them and still received no service so we left. Decided on Zooks down the lot and it was great. I was excited to try this place but was really disappointed with the service.

UiZsD6DCdNHmWKXyHxEfSA.text: There isn't much that would bring me back here.  Ordered a benedict and a short stack of pancakes and both items were average, coffee nothing to rave about either.  Prices are ridiculous for a breakfast/brunch location.  $4 for iced tea and $6 for a short stack of pancakes is insane.  Total for two of us before tip was $44, that's never going to grab a breakfast regular.   The parking has always been a challenge in this center and it wasn't any better today.  Bathrooms were also unavailable due to a "sewer backup".  I know it's only two weeks in and would have been forgiving for food mistakes, etc. but the pricing, vibe and other options in the area have nothing to do with "working out the initial kinks".

Xfx38HTbCrTgvbEVibcSMg.text: Their food is PHENOMENAL! Everything is fresh and sooo well prepared it is by far the best breakfast I have ever had. Their hash browns are fresh and cooked to perfection. The omelettes are super soft and again all fresh delicious ingredients added. The pancakes and thick and soft by far the BEST pancakes I have ever had. Their Rueben's are delicious as well, the meat is super good quality which is nice. And their mimosas are heavy on the champagne and made with fresh juices (they have different mimosa options raspberry, orange, etc.) Oh and the amount of food they give you is amazing. I usually finish my meals but I gave my toddler my pancakes and still had half my omelette left over to bring home. Staff was great, everyone went above and beyond to provide the best service and experience possible. The manager Michael even came by to check on how things tasted and how service was. I will definitely be coming back and I live 30 minutes away!

RAv3GSWLkRxEAl4L5JFNsw.text: This is my third time at this establishment; so obviously I like it, except for today! I ordered the Cristo, which while I had an idea it wasn't a Monte Cristo, I didn't think it would be bad. It was very eggy tasting and the ham was not tender. The waitress was very nice and asked me if I wanted something else. I asked for an almond croissant. She later came back to tell me the croissants are still baking!  It's 7:45AM! Shouldn't they already be baked before the restaurant opens??? I was very disappointed today, not sure I'll be back.

jKtEQlErTDDhQLVXA4Rpcg.text: Not a good one today. Went in to have a quick Breakfast and no one came over to help. Normally pretty good service but today was very disappointing.

88_ABVwrfW1oTGETgLujIA.text: Yes it is Mothers day, yes it was extremely busy, yes we waited for a whole 27 minutes but the food was spot on. Good quality, huge portions, friendly caring staff. I will be back.

H8qYjkO89nICo3aZO1YDZw.text: This is my second visit to Elly's in two weeks.  There selection is great.  My cousin stated this is the best breakfast she has had in Phoenix. And she drives from the westside to dine here.  I most second her opinion.

aRgdm72kEPUdLIrTzVRV4w.text: So happy so see more neighborhood alternatives to lgoNo! Much better pkg & worth drive! Glad to see more Chicago based cos out here too...

8Ozi_hoEipHeg9y8kcKoww.text: I had the BEST version of eggs benedict ever.  Ashley our server was just awesome.  The moment you walk you feel invited.  I live in Seattle WA, and only get to visit Phoenix AZ a couple times a year, this will be a place I revisit every time.

jFSLSX8Xdm_9wGWFTuak2w.text: I love this place! Great location! Affordable prices and tasty food. What I like the most is the service. The staff is always so friendly. They hold the door for customers coming in and out. It's often busy but they are still pleasant and kind. They also help one another out. I had 2 servers this visit a gentleman with curly hair and a lovely young lady who has served me in the past here.  Highly recommended!

JIXE0HOGzAG7RUUnnIm4Lg.text: I am all about service, and places that understand this concept. This is one of those places with a manager who truly understand this principle.   Our experience started out great then kept going the wrong direction on service. Once I brought up our declining situation to their attention they took complete responsibility right away. They apologized immediately and explained what the situation and issue was that caused the shift in our service. The recovery from the Staff and Manager completely exceeded my expectations, they went way beyond what they needed to do to correct our situation. You have to respect a Restauranteur who handled this situation the way he did, he certainly earned my respect and continued support.      The food is excellent, as well as the ambiance and vibe which is spot on. This establishment is a must to try, if you are reading this review go give this place a shot, they will not let you have a bad dinning experience.

IicSEaI7HC9EG6Lb1soGOQ.text: Best Breakfast and Lunch in Phoenix.  This has become our favorite spot for breakfast, and we drive all the way from North West Phoenix to enjoy it.  We love all the selections here, all excellently prepared with generous portions.  The Pancakes are magnificent, unlike most others, they are bursting with rich flavor.  All Egg dishes are prepared perfectly, the Coffee is the best, and the Dining Room is comfortable and airy.    Elly's is the best in town, don't pass it up.

IJexH_RSvSZZ8yQ2AQmbEw.text: Staff is amazing all around! Great job on hiring great ppl. I had the southwest frittata and it was very savory and well balanced. Tasted fresh! HIGHLY RECOMMEND if you're in the area or just visiting Phoenix.

4Y46rn3-jPb62sa6OYCoHw.text: This place is awesome and not to expensive. Staff always nice place is always crowded but never really a long wait. Coffee is ok for the price juice is really good. Great place for a brunch.

GBipm6wnsYiCgHG3g204zw.text: If you live in Phoenix and haven't tried Elly's Brunch & Cafe, get down there this weekend, or now! Truly some of the best pancakes I've ever had. Tucked in the northeast corner of the Uptown Plaza, Elly's is a happening breakfast spot to satisfy your craving for delicious skillets, scrambles, sweet breakfast treats and anything in between. First off, this place is HUGE you definitely can't tell how massive the restaurant is from the outside. I normally visit Elly's for early brunch on Saturday's or Sunday's and have never had to wait for a table. However by the time my party leaves around noon, I've noticed there is about a 10-15 minute wait, so come early! They do have a nice patio with misters right outside the front door to the restaurant. I can't wait to enjoy it in the cooler months! The service at Elly's is also excellent. You can tell the management has trained their peeps very well. Several times I've asked the wait staff for their recommendations and they are eager to help me choose the perfect dish. My go-to is the Southwest Frittata (Cherrywood bacon, avocado, onion, jalapeno, tomato and American cheese) with a side of pancakes. You just can't go wrong! Don't forget to order an Iced Chai or Matcha, both are so yummy! Next time I hope to try the breakfast sandwich, it looks delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southwest Frittata (very cheesy, but very delicious)
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pancakes, Southwest Frittata &amp; Iced Chai

M2mDxmgX7oONEgE12IQ0PA.text: Wow. We were pleased with everything. Chessa was our server and she is prompt, friendly and funny. Gave great recommendations to us. She said the hollandaise was excellent   I ordered it and she is right. My Provence Benedict was awesome.  Hubby got the Meat Lover's Skillet and loved it. Chessa said the make the best pancakes so my hubby had them instead of toast. They are amazing. Light fluffy and easy to overeat.  It will be our breakfast joint from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gVKeSg0LS0yKcFMoJp2mRg.text: Great options for food. The staff was incredibly friendly. If you like bloody Marys, don't forget to try the Diablo

JSRawacLsC3IQ6kmsyACAQ.text: This is the best brunch in Phoenix. Their pancakes--yummy! I got a veggie frittata and it was to die for. I will only say if you get a spicy Bloody Mary--and I love spicy--they mean it!! Go w the regular Bloody Mary.  This is a Chicago breakfast place that is now in Phoenix and we are the lucky ones!!

xIKlPF6YQ47xtw0K7qc65Q.text: Breakfast was wonderful! Amazing portions ! The staff was friendly and welcoming. Coming back for sure ! Cornbeef & hash amazing!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dN79qWeRR46QCoVHyUriiw.text: Okay, they have a 5$ sandwich and it is DELICIOUS. Sooooo yeah tho place is awesome. I was wary to give it a try because of how trendy it seemed, and I have been burned by the trendy brunch places before. I would recommend the basic 5$ sandwich on their menu because it is filling and still comes with potatoes. The other good our group has had was really good as well. Haven't had a bad plate so far.

XEEHEDy9qzwVcHkBl80ZBw.text: Amazing service and food! Went here for the first time with family from out of town. They loved it so much they wanted to come back the next day! I felt the same way. There are just so many options that all sound delicious and for a decent price I must add! We went at 10am on a Sunday with a group of 5 and it only took 20 minutes to get sat even though it was packed in there! Overall, extremely impressed and happy.  P.S. I did get a mimosa and it was pretty skimpy so only downside was the mimosa size

jjmwGLWVQEHCYteLIGSJxQ.text: Enjoyed this restaurant several times in the past. Very disappointing experience this morning. Was seated at a dirty table. Over five minutes before a server brought water and took a drink order.  Told server we were ready to order, he asked us to wait and took a large order from another table first. Up- charge for substitutions. Walked-out without ordering. Doubt I would go back! There are many similar places with better service in the area.

Md0ujenrKFY6snJkD-yhxg.text: We enjoyed our brunch here last week. We came at an off time (2 pm) on a Saturday so we were seated right away. There were still plenty of patrons in the restaurant at that time.  The cold brew was smooth and delicious - no cream or sugar needed. My other half got the Wild Mushroom & Steak Skillet - the meat was moist, tender, flavorful and juicy. (Umm, can I have a plate of that only please?). I ordered the Benedict on the croissant with Portabella mushrooms and veggies. This was light and tasty, the hollandaise had a nice tang to it.  Will be back to try other menu items. Perhaps the Mascarpone crepes, but definitely another one of the Wild Mushroom & Steak Skillets (hold the hash).  Service was friendly and quick without making us feel rushed.

NXFiEAJJsm3Z2HnqlmHdbQ.text: Great service, extensive menu, great coffee and casual atmosphere. My husband and I were super pleased for an easy early breakfast Saturday morning.

HKIf4DjJjtX5oaw8qcA2rw.text: So today was my 3rd time here. I have tried 3 different entrees and eaten bites of other items including the big apple pancake. Have yet to find anything I did not like. Possibly because I don't go to breakfast later than 7 I have never had poor service and of course at that hour no wait time. I did notice we had no trouble conversing over the music this time. Only one little gripe, by the time the toast gets to the table it won't melt the somewhat soft butter. That is something that many restaurants have a problem with. It is a restaurant I have recommended to others and I'm sure my friends and I will return again.

LGBLaa_iwGgu9WmWWt1t5g.text: This is my boyfriend and I's favorite breakfast place and go to for a Sunday breakfast! You get HUGE portion sizes for a great price and the food is amazing. Our server talked my boyfriend into trying the Corned Beef Hash and he now gets it every time because it's so good. The inside is much bigger than it looks with lots of seating, and the patio is great to bring your dog. The servers are all very friendly and we've never had a bad experience.

I0GeKuPIGwZSTk7odyQQTg.text: Kids review "The kids French toast was really good! I liked the powered sugar and the 2 pieces of French toast were just enough to make me full"  There was a mix up as as to if we could call head for a reservation (you can't) but manager Michael and host Justin helped us get it figured out and we were able to sit exactly at our "reservation " time. That aside the food way GREAT! I had the veggie omelet and the portion was awesome and the goat cheese was THE BEST! I will definitely be coming back. Tip: get here early to put your name in. Very busy place and for good reason !

ROq0M-N3auBZ4ksTx51RlQ.text: Sad to say  I was looking for a new breakfast place tried this place 3-4 times and the service is never what is should be !! Food is either wrong ,cold or over cooked .  I mentioned it to one of the helpers by the name of Kurt  he answer was ,oh well ! I mentioned pancake were chocolate chip waited a long while for waitress to let her know  after sitting there fo a hour and half  the we're supposed to be Regular pancakes  ,We ordered a medium cooked burger came out well done overcooked  Order steak and eggs steak medium done came out over cooked  waitress was always too busy to see if we needed anything else we Got So fed up waiting the Waitress if we need any food corrections it would just take so much longer Mentioned the upset to a gentleman by the name curt that was helping out getting the bill  mentioned our frustrations and he was like oh well ! that is not a way to treat a customer that is trying to do business with a well ran business  So I do not Recommend this place of business unless you want to be upset and waste your time

sIJ61RX0ahjAxtWT3f0kZg.text: Very cute restaurant, friendly staff, lots of options for breakfast/brunch. Delicious food . Cater to allergies. Good cappuccino. Had a southwest omelette-super delicious, very creamy guacamole and cheese inside

LmzO9q8TagKvnr8Q7tLipQ.text: You guys, I want to love this place so terribly! I took a picture of my food because it looked amazing. I ordered the Original Eggs Benedict. The eggs were overcooked, so there was no yoke to overflow into the ham and muffin, the English muffin was odd-it was almost as if it was stale (extremely hard, not easy to chew). Ideally I would have loved more sauce.   I plan on giving this place a second chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eFHo7tk81-ZOvN9pSoGSdw.text: The quality, taste and size of food was very good.  Unfortunately my Mocha latte did not appear to have any Mocha in it.  Our fabulous Waitress, Meghan was welcoming, friendly, attentive and efficient.  We felt important and well taken care of - 10 star service!

Y08_cDI_T9GH0XE4KUub5w.text: Really great breakfast joint.  Efficient and friendly service.  Huge dining area so there's never a wait to sit down, even on a holiday weekend.  Their extensive menu has something for everyone.  Omelettes are HUGE.  Crepes are also very generous.  If you can wait 30 minutes, there's a dutch baby oven pancake on the menu.  Generous portions for all.  The only thing we didn't care for was the espresso.  It was sour tasting, almost like vinegar. We wouldn't order any espresso drink there again.  Otherwise, we loved Elly's and would come here again.

IBdlLIeQBu9C-j3pVK9gTw.text: We were visiting from Minnesota.  Yelping for breakfast and found Elly's Brunch & Cafe!  Yes there was a wait... it was SO worth the wait!  The service and food was amazing!  Very good!  Very clean!!!  We would definitely come back!  Highly recommend!

9yLxw11CH1CZHMkqTQcxtA.text: Definitely will be back here again! We were seated immediately despite the place seeming packed. I had the avocado wrap and a couple $3 mimosas (can't beat that price!) and both were delicious. Food came out incredibly fast and service was amazing. Not sure why I hadn't been here sooner but its definitely going into our regular brunch rotation. Check it out!

fj3Q8IiTdMwp1NQi3YV5pQ.text: I am all about the breakfast. Any time of day or night, I delight in pancakes, omelettes, biscuits & gravy and oh! french toasts. Came across this place when looking for breakfast near my new address and was stunned by how great their food is. I have only worked through about 15 of their dishes but each delights me even more than the last. Bring at least a party of 3 so you can all sample the dutch baby, the buckwheat pancake (!!!!!!!) and the chilaquiles verdes..... oh and maybe the classic crepe - BEST crepe in town .... oh and get the biscuits & gravy - different-ish but delicious. If you go early, there is hardly even a wait. Pro tip: the buckwheat pancakes taste amazing on day one... but if you have leftovers and microwave them the next day they are almost as good.... and you wait one more day- they are still f-ing amazing.

yX1WpVce_PhzOvQfOGXc6A.text: I tried this place for the first time on New Year's day and I was overall happy with my breakfast. My party and I waited for 30 mins which is expected considering there was other hungover people starving for some good food. The location is very clean and in a cute little location in downtown Phx. The service was prompt on getting us our drinks and taking our order. (Friendly staff) Always keeping our coffee cups filled.  I ordered the avacado wrap with bacon and a side of hash browns. The pics on Yelp looked appealing so I decided to try it out. I was extremly happy with the hashbrowns. The wrap was good but only disappointment I had was barely any bacon in it. It was chopped up finly and very little to nothing in my wrap. Next time I come back I would try to ask for the bacon to come on the side so I get actual whole pieces or I would try the chicken option they offer. I think it would be nice if they offered complimentary coffee while you wait for your party to be seated.

FYLxag5XoLt4_YS0dlh6zw.text: I have to admit that this might be one of our new favorite breakfast places.  The service was fast and our server John took good care of us.  We had the Denver omelet and the veggie omelet which had wild mushrooms, tomato, onion and goat cheese.  Both were delicious!  The stringy hash browns were awesome too.  The sourdough artisan toast was amazing!!!   The portion size was huge and a great value for a breakfast meal.  Try this place, you won't be sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eeIiMQhpszWbVOWk07o5gA.text: Really liked it.  Nice atmosphere and good food.  This place could finally give Snooze a run for its money.  They have a solid menu with some nice suprises on the classics.

-4aeo2Gg1UTPbXzM31VhPQ.text: Checked out this place for the first time. They are located in the Uptown Plaza at Central and Camelback, tucked away in the corner near West Elm and Creamistry. The patio and interior are decorated nicely and the staff was friendly. As I waited at the coffee center, more than once I was asked if I had been helped. I appreciate the attentiveness. I asked if they had any coffee drinks that could be made iced and was told that any of them can be made iced. I ordered the Mint White Chocolate in the 12 oz size along with a pastry for their grab and go special. The barista allowed me to sample the drink that is usually made hot to see if it was to my liking. It was creamy and minty and a nice spring green color. I agreed that it was great and got my pastry and left.  It wasnt until I arrived at work and was reviewing their to-go menu that what I ordered and what was on the menu listed an 12 oz or 16 oz drink. What I received was more like an 8 oz cup that was 1/2 to 3/4 of the way full. Other than the sip I had taken in the restaurant to taste, I had not consumed any more of the beverage.  I dont know if this size was for the grab and go special as it didnt indicate a size on the sign that I noticed.  I enjoyed the drink, althought I would have liked more of it. The pastry, an almond covered croissant, was generous in size and was fresh and flavorful.  Outside of the drink mishap, I think I will return to try lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Almond croissant
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The cup of iced mint white chocolate.
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cup says 8 oz when the menu lists this as a 12 or 16 oz drink.

Qzrhhzmd35t9BLJO18xv4Q.text: I've been mulling about how I feel about this place. Its definitely a grade A brunch spot comparable to all the other new brunch areas that have been opening up recently. Which I suppose is part of why I had to think of it so long. The place is cute and menu expansive but definitely not something new.  My Spartan omelet was jam packed and delcious. Pretty much all the food came with sides. My omelette came with hash browns AND toast.   They were doing a donation drive where if you donated money you get a pumpkin to decorate, which in turn they would put around the restaurant. I love that concept!! So neat and a nice touch seeing the unique pumpkins on everyone's tables.  I have to deduct a star because the service was extremely slow throughout the entire experience. There was a point where one person in our party had finished their drink before someone else could get their drink. They also had some condiments that were not available - for example barbecue sauce even though they serve burgers.  I can see Elly's being included in my brunch circuit - but definitely just when I have enough time and not to hungry to accommodate the slow service.

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Small portion of the outside dining and coffee bar
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grab and go pastry area
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Donate to St. Mary&#39;s Food bank and get a little pumpkin to decorate. They had the decorated pumpkins on the tables. Cute!!

Q2wEo-q3M24w2O8uPzdJFw.text: Well this was surprisingly wonderful. Even though it wasn't on the menu, the barista made me a fab London Fog. French toast was terrific, according to my travel mate. My eggs Benedict was glorious! Great service. Comfy booth seating! We will be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Uzq3EA5dDo8I2RooXKBtXw.text: I would like to preface this review with the fact that - the food is absolutely delicious. Both times I've been here it's been absolutely delicious.  Unfortunately, today my fiance and I received very poor service. When we walked in we were greeted by a nice hostess who promptly seated us. When our server came over she wasn't very inviting, nor did she tell us her name or any sort of specials/recommendations. She asked us if we were ready to order, and we let her know that we weren't quite sure yet, and would need a few minutes.  About two minutes later we closed our menus and put them down, which is generally a good sign to indicate that you're ready to order. She didn't return back to our table for about 10 minutes, but we brushed it off because we figured it was our fault for not being prepared when she asked.  After we ordered, we didn't see her again until she brought our food to the table (the food was hot, and delicious). My fiance decided that he would like a coke, because initially we had only ordered water. She took so long to come back to our table, that we flagged a different waitress over to ask for a soda. The new waitress went and told Mikylah (our waitress) what we asked for, and we still didn't receive a soda for 12 more minutes. The new waitress then brought the soda over without any sort of apology or explanation.   We still hadn't talked to our serve, Mikylah, since our food was dropped off at our table. At this point we were completely done eating and ended up waiting over 15 minutes from the time we finished our food, until she came back to our table.   When she came back to the table, she didn't have our check ready and had to go back to get it. When she dropped it off we still didn't receive any sort of explanation or apology for the situation.  I'm not sure if she was training, or if it was just an off day- but it really was an unfortunate experience. Also, the restaurant was fairly empty and it looked like she was only responsible for our table (of two people) and another table (of 6 girls).

wlrEEjrCAf-7QOu4vRbDeg.text: Amazing service and delicious food! Very affordable as well. We ordered a variety of menu items and were not disappointed. The homemade biscuits are drool worthy!

photos.caption: Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pecan roll
Photo of Elly's Brunch & Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shroom omelette, homemade biscuits, bacon waffle, corned beef hash with poached eggs, berry and mascarpone pancakes, and southwest frittata

KDLKmGuqCCeMjONsWDC9Qw.text: Nice location and plenty of seating- had the cheese burger which was good and the bacon was perfect. The hand cut French fries were very good and I'd come back for those. One of my fellow diners got the cheese burger with bacon and added a fried egg and he loved it. The salad was good and filling plus the omelet and hash browns were very good. The selection of iced teas is great and the peach tea I had was very good. The chocolate pancake was delicious and the maple syrup was very delicious. I plan on returning for the eggs Benedict as they looked delectable. I'm thinking that the breakfast options are the main draw here. I will be back!
